main event: On April 12, 1953, a crew aboard a C-47 aircraft observed approximately ten unidentified objects over Sweetwater, Nevada.
interesting points: The objects were described as round and flat, metallic in color, and observed in a loose, changing formation., The objects were at an estimated altitude of 7500 feet and were flying on a heading of approximately 150 degrees., The observer reported no sound, trail, or exhaust from the objects., The sighting lasted for about 2-3 minutes while the aircraft maneuvered for a better view., The presence of no other aircraft in the area was noted, and the weather conditions were slightly hazy with visibility of 30 miles.
sighted object: approximately ten round flat metallic colored objects
witness description: crew members of a C-47 aircraft including Major Fred G. Paddleford, 2nd Lt Frank E. White, and 2nd Lt John Clapper.
